Submodules¶

ALD.Lovebox.lovebox_hw module¶

Created on Feb 2, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.Lovebox.lovebox_hw.LoveboxHW(app, debug=False, name=None)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.hardware.HardwareComponent

Hardware component wrapper for use with Dwyer Love Controls Series 4B PID Temperature controller. In theory, this hardware component should be compatible with other commonly available temperature controllers such as the Omega Engineering CN7500 since they use the same command library.

CTRL_METHODS = ('PID', 'ON/OFF', 'Manual', 'PID_Program')¶
HEAT_COOL_CTRLS = 'Heating'¶
connect()¶

Opens a connection to hardware and connects LoggedQuantity settings to related hardware functions and parameters

desired_PID_profile = (7.7, 53, 13)¶
disconnect()¶

Disconnects the hardware and severs hardware–LoggedQuantity links

initial_PID_defaults = (30.0, 28, 7)¶
name = 'lovebox'¶
set_control_method(control)¶

Sets currently active control mode.

Arguments Type Description
control str
Temperature Control Method
(see table below)
Control Method String Entry
PID “PID”
ON/OFF “ON/OFF”
Manual tuning “Manual”
PID program control “PID_Program”
set_heat_cool_control(control)¶
Arguments Type Description
control str Heating control mode. Other modes are currently disabled.
Control Method String Entry
Heating “Heating”
setup()¶

Runs during __init__, before the hardware connection is established Should generate desired LoggedQuantities, operations

ALD.Lovebox.lovebox_measure module¶

Created on Feb 6, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.Lovebox.lovebox_measure.LoveboxMeasure(app)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.measurement.Measurement

name = 'lovebox'¶
run()¶

run method runs in an separate thread and is used for data acquisition

No GUI updates should occur within the run function, any Qt related GUI work should occur in update_display()

setup()¶

Override this to set up logged quantities and gui connections Runs during __init__, before the hardware connection is established Should generate desired LoggedQuantities

ALD.Lovebox.pid_controller module¶

@author: Ed Barnard Updated by Alan Buckley (2/6, 3/15, 5/15 of 2018)

class ALD.Lovebox.pid_controller.PIDController(port='COM1', address=1, debug=False)¶

Bases: object

Generic PID Controller communicating via RS-485 Modbus ASCII protocol.

Communications library works with PID controllers including but not limited to the following models:

  • Omega CN7500
  • Dwyer Love Controls 4B
CTRL_METHODS = ('PID', 'ON/OFF', 'Manual', 'PID Program Ctrl')¶
HEAT_COOL_CTRLS = ('Heating', 'Cooling', 'Heating/Cooling', 'Cooling/Heating')¶
analog_read_command(register, length)¶
analog_write_command(register, data)¶
autotune(status)¶

Initiate/Stop autotune feature which automatically tunes PID parameters.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
status boolean int Proportional term value (0, 1)
close()¶

Closes serial connection. Removes serial object.

load_settings()¶

Reads all settings from controller

lock = None¶

If port is a Serial object (or other file-like object) use it instead of creating a new serial port

modbus_command(command, register, data)¶
read_ctrl_method()¶
Value Control Method
0 PID
1 ON/OFF
2 Manual tuning
3 PID program control
Returns:(int) Active temperature approach method
read_ctrl_run()¶

Reads regular control Run/Stop setting.

Value Description
0 Stop
1 Run
Returns:(bool) Value representing program Run/Stop status.
read_derivative_time()¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Derivative_time

Returns:(int) PID Derivative term value.
read_for_data_log()¶
read_heat_cool_ctrl()¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.heat_cool_control

Value Control Method
0 Heating
1 Cooling
2 Heating/Cooling
3 Cooling/Heating
Returns:tuple: (int, str). Active Heating/Cooling control method. See above table for reference.
read_integral_time()¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Integral_time

Returns:(int) PID Integral term value.
read_output1()¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.output1

Returns:(float) Output 1 percentage value in units of 0.1 %.
read_output2()¶
Returns:(float) Output 2 percentage value in units of 0.1 %.
read_pid_ctrl_run()¶

Reads PID program control status.

Value Description Returned Value
0 Running True
1 Stopped False
Returns:(bool) Value representing whether PID program control is running.
read_pid_preset()¶

In PID control mode, this command reads currently selected PID mode out of 4 possible PID preset modes. If n=4 is selected, the unit will perform auto-tuning. (Auto PID parameter)

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.PID_preset

Returns:(int) Selected PID preset.
read_pid_sv()¶

Reads set point value in current PID control mode.

Returns:(float) Current set point value.
read_prop_band()¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Proportional_band

Returns:(float) PID Proportional term value.
read_setpoint()¶

Reads stored Set Point Value from temperature controller

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.sv_setpoint

Returns:(float) Stored Set Point Value in Celsius.
read_temp()¶

Reads Process Value from temperature controller.

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.pv_temp

Returns:(float) Process Value in Celsius.
send_analog_read(register, length=None)¶

Sends an analog read command FC 0x03 to device.

Returns:(int16) Array of length “length”.
send_analog_write(register, data)¶

Sends analog write command to register 0x06.

set_ctrl_method(ctrl_method_i)¶

Sets active temperature approach method.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
ctrl_method_i int Integer corresponding to desired mode of operation. See table below. (0, 3)
Value Control Method
0 PID
1 ON/OFF
2 Manual tuning
3 PID program control
set_ctrl_run(run)¶

Sets regular program Run/Stop status.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
run int Boolean integer which tells the controller whether or not to run its PID control mode. See table below. (0, 1)
Value Description
0 Stop
1 Run
set_derivative_time(derivative_t)¶

Sets PID Derivative term value.

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Derivative_time

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
derivative_t int Derivative term value (0, 9999)
set_heat_cool_ctrl(heat_cool_ctrl_i)¶

Sets Heating/Cooling mode of operation.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
heat_cool_ctrl_i int Integer corresponding to desired mode of operation. See table below. (0, 3)
Value Control Method
0 Heating
1 Cooling
2 Heating/Cooling
3 Cooling/Heating
Returns:tuple: (int, str). Intended Heating/Cooling control method. See above table for reference.
set_integral_time(integral_t)¶

Sets PID Integral term value.

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Integral_time

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
integral_t int Integral term value (0, 9999)
set_output1(outp1)¶

Set output percentage in units of 0.1% Write operation valid only in manual tuning mode.

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.output1

Arguments Type Description
outp1 str Desired
Returns:(float) Output 1 percentage value in units of 0.1 %.
set_output2(outp2)¶

Set output percentage in units of 0.1% Write operation valid only in manual tuning mode.

Arguments Type Description
outp2 str Desired
Returns:(float) Output 2 percentage value in units of 0.1 %.
set_pid_ctrl_run(run)¶

Sets PID program control status.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
run int Boolean integer which tells the controller whether or not to run its PID control mode. See table below. (0, 1)
Argument Description
True (1) Run
False (0) Stop
set_pid_preset(pid)¶

In PID control mode, this command reads currently selected PID mode out of 4 possible PID preset modes. If n=4 is selected, the unit will perform auto-tuning. (Auto PID parameter)

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.PID_preset

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
pid int Integer corresponding to desired PID preset. See table below. (0, 4)
Value PID Preset
(0, 3) PID mode
4 Auto PID mode
set_pid_sv(sv)¶

Writes set point value in current PID control mode.

Arguments Type Description
sv float Desired PID setpoint value.
set_prop_band(p)¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.Proportional_band

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
p float Proportional term value (0.1, 999.9)
set_setpoint(setp)¶

Connected to LoggedQuantity app.hardware.lovebox.settings.sv_setpoint

Stores Set Point Value to temperature controller

Arguments Type Description
setp str Desired set point value in units of Celsius.
Returns:(float) Stored Set Point value written to the temperature controller. (This is not a response from the controller)
